page.title: 15Chevet Hall in Wakefield
page.content: On our land use survey we visited Chevet Park which was at one time part of the estate of Chevet Hall. We discovered that the Hall, which for many years provided employment in the area, had been demolished. One of our class members has a grandmother who remembers the sale of the contents of the Hall so we enquired into it because many of the older people thought it was a pity that the Hall was no longer there. Chevet Hall was the home of the local landed gentry, the Pilkington family, for over 200 years. The family were noted for the care and support that they gave to the area and its people. It was a sad day, therefore, when the l4th Baronet decided to sell the Hall and move to Hertfordshire. The old Wakefield Corporation bought Chevet Hall in l949 for Â£8,000.
